intro: Micromeles atrosanguinea, commonly known as the black blood vine, is a woody shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers.
